Buffalo, New York. Donald Herbert, a City of Buffalo firefighter who was severely injured during a 1995 roof collapse died this past Tuesday from pneumonia and other complications stemming from his injuries sustained in that incident. He gained international attention from the miraculous recovery after a decade-long coma last May. He truly died in the line of duty.:( 
 Now, a question I would like to pose here. While this was going on, Terri Schiavo's life was hanging on a thread by an out of control Florida appealate court judge. Her "husband" was more interested in the money from the settlement, rather than truly caring for his wife (remember he had a girlfriend and fathered two children with her). Why didn't Michael divorce Terri and let her parents care for her? Or why didn't Michael be a man and care for her himself?

Donald Herbert, a City of Buffalo firefighter who was severely injured during a 1995 roof collapse died this past Tuesday from pneumonia and other complications stemming from his injuries sustained in that incident. He gained international attention from the miraculous recovery after a decade-long coma last May. He truly died in the line of duty.:( 
 Now, a question I would like to pose here. While this was going on, Terri Schiavo's life was hanging on a thread by an out of control Florida appealate court judge. Her "husband" was more interested in the money from the settlement, rather than truly caring for his wife (remember he had a girlfriend and fathered two children with her). Why didn't Michael divorce Terri and let her parents care for her? Or why didn't Michael be a man and care for her himself?

 Are we going to resurrect the Terri Schiavo debate again? Is there anything new to add to what has already been said over and over? There is nothing to connect the two cases mentioned since Mr. Herbert was in a coma termed Minimally Conscious and Ms Schiavo was in a Persistent Vegetative State.
 Dono

Buffalo, New York. Donald Herbert, a City of Buffalo firefighter who was severely injured during a 1995 roof collapse died this past Tuesday from pneumonia and other complications stemming from his injuries sustained in that incident. He gained international attention from the miraculous recovery after a decade-long coma last May. He truly died in the line of duty.:( 
 Now, a question I would like to pose here. While this was going on, Terri Schiavo's life was hanging on a thread by an out of control Florida appealate court judge. Her "husband" was more interested in the money from the settlement, rather than truly caring for his wife (remember he had a girlfriend and fathered two children with her). Why didn't Michael divorce Terri and let her parents care for her? Or why didn't Michael be a man and care for her himself?

 
 Probably becuase Terri was in a persistive vegatative state. HEr brain was gone. She died many years before. AS far as the money, that has been completely disproven. There was almost none of that money left. Additionally, he turned down 2 offers, one for a million dollars and one for $10 million (apparently from people who did not realize that Michael did not make the decision to pull the plug, the court did, and there was nothing he could do to stop it). 
 
 A lessor man might have walked away. He did not. He stuck around to make sure that her wishes were carried out.

 While I won't go as far as ascribing altruistic reasons for his doing so, I did admit that she was ultimately proven to be in a persistent vegetative state and as such, was already dead.
